final.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc
final.translation[0].definitions[0].note: final demand British English (=the last bill you receive for money you owe before court action is taken against you)
final.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The final episode will be shown tonight.
students preparing for their final examinations
Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
the final stages in their relationship
They scored in the final minutes of the game.
The final whistle (=blown at the end of a game) was only seconds away when Redknapp equalised.
final.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: being the result at the end of a process
final.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: the quality of the final product
Does anyone know the final score?
I do not know what the final outcome will be.
final.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a decision, offer, answer etc is final, it cannot or will not be changed
final.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say.
She’s not coming with us, and that’s final!
final.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: happening at or near the end of an event or process
final.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: In the final years of his life, Hervey achieved high office in the church.
final.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: used to emphasize that the last thing in a series of events is very severe or damaging
final.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The vote of no confidence was the final humiliation for a government that had been clinging to office.
final.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition
final.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He’s through to the men’s tennis final for the first time.
final.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college
final.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the last in a series of things, actions, or events
final.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: An official announcement was expected following a final meeting at the tyre manufacturer’s Milan headquarters.
The US-based company is still arguing with several contractors over thefinal bill.
foreign currency receipts from the final instalment of the sale of British Steel shares
final.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a decision, offer, agreement etc that is final cannot be changed
final.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Members must vote in favor again next year for thedecision to becomefinal.
District Court judge Thomas Jackson issued a final ruling, calling for the company to be split into two parts.
final.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a final piece of writing or set of figures has been prepared in several stages, and is now considered to be correct
final.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: The changes agreed at our meeting of 25 March have been incorporated in the final draft.
The provisional estimate of retail sales volume for October was 119.0; thefinal estimate is closer to 116.9.
final.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: a legal judgement or decision which is final and binding has to be obeyed because it has been decided in a court of law
final.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: Some contracts refer technical disputes to an expert whose decision isfinal and binding.
